entry.title: Weather Scraping in Python
entry.summary:
Scraping Wunderground Weather with Python for Reasons¶

About a half-year ago, I was asked to do an analysis of umbrella sales in relation to weather changes for a major convenience store's Shanghai and other regional shops. I thought, okay, this kind of focused product sales analysis is generally quite boring to me, but it came with a couple of unexpected twists that made it more interesting (surprise, people generally buy umbrellas when it rains. Just kidding, it's actually much more complicated than that, and even rainy days can be further broken done and analyzed by intensity of rain, wind speed, etc., all things that might affect people's propensity for purchasing umbrellas).

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Scraping-Wunderground-Weather-with-Python-for-Reasons">Scraping Wunderground Weather with Python for Reasons<a class="anchor-link" href="#Scraping-Wunderground-Weather-with-Python-for-Reasons">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>About a half-year ago, I was asked to do an analysis of umbrella sales in relation to weather changes for a major convenience store's Shanghai and other regional shops. I thought, okay, this kind of focused product sales analysis is generally quite boring to me, but it came with a couple of unexpected twists that made it more interesting (surprise, people generally buy umbrellas when it rains. Just kidding, it's actually much more complicated than that, and even rainy days can be further broken done and analyzed by intensity of rain, wind speed, etc., all things that might affect people's propensity for purchasing umbrellas).</p>
<p>While I would love to do a post on the time-series and sales analysis and some subsequent machine learning and modeling around Shanghai weather and umbrella sales over the course of two years, I am pretty sure that would put me in front of a judge facing a hefty lawsuit.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="A-Twist:-I-couldn't-find-openly-available-historical-weather-data-for-Chinese-cities">A Twist: I couldn't find openly available historical weather data for Chinese cities<a class="anchor-link" href="#A-Twist:-I-couldn't-find-openly-available-historical-weather-data-for-Chinese-cities">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>I know, I know, why didn't I just check out the NOAA, proud American that I am?</p>
<p>Two reasons.</p>
<p>One, this project coincided with the lengthy Trumpian federal shutdown. The NOAA treated me to a redirect saying that the data was unavailable due to them not being able to keep the server up, due to unpaid bills. And it was not like I could wait around for the government shutdown to end to do my job.</p>
<p>Second, a colleague had pulled Shanghai weather data from the NOAA previously, and it didn't have the dimensiones I was looking for.</p>
<p>I did ask some Chinese colleagues to hunt around the Chinese web for good weather data, but they were unable to turn up any sites with open data sharing. The one site that seemed promising had very low resolution data.</p>
<p>Wunderground, on the other hand, is a lovely site with surprisingly granular data for Chinese cities. I wonder where they scrape it from.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h4 id="Typical-Python-Programming-Setup-Using-Selenium-and-a-Headless-Chrome-Driver">Typical Python Programming Setup Using Selenium and a Headless Chrome Driver<a class="anchor-link" href="#Typical-Python-Programming-Setup-Using-Selenium-and-a-Headless-Chrome-Driver">¶</a></h4>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">bs4</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">csv</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">datetime</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">os</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pandas</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">pd</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">psycopg2</span>

<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">selenium</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">webdriver</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">selenium.webdriver.support.ui</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">WebDriverWait</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">selenium.webdriver.support</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">expected_conditions</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="n">EC</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">selenium.webdriver.common.by</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">By</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">selenium.common.exceptions</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">TimeoutException</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">selenium.webdriver.chrome.options</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">Options</span>

<span class="n">chrome_path</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">os</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">path</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">join</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">os</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">getcwd</span><span class="p">(),</span> <span class="s2">"chromedriver.exe"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">options</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Options</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">options</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">add_argument</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"--window-size=3200,1800"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">options</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">add_argument</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"--disable-gpu"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1">#probably not necessary, since my laptop doesn't have one</span>
<span class="n">options</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">add_argument</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"--start-maximized"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">options</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">add_argument</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"--headless"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#Columns as used in the website's weather table</span>
<span class="n">header</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span>
    <span class="s1">'Date'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="s1">'Time'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="s1">'Temperature'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="s1">'Dew Point'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="s1">'Humidity'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="s1">'Wind'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="s1">'Wind Speed'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="s1">'Wind Gust'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="s1">'Pressure'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="s1">'Precip.'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="s1">'Precip Accum'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="s1">'Condition'</span>
<span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#date generator</span>
<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">daterange</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">start_date</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">end_date</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">n</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">int</span> <span class="p">((</span><span class="n">end_date</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">start_date</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">days</span><span class="p">)):</span>
        <span class="k">yield</span> <span class="n">start_date</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">datetime</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">timedelta</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">scrape_weather_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">csv_writer</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">'''Takes a date_range iterable (list or generator), uses dates to construct</span>
<span class="sd">    webpage queries and to index output'''</span>

    <span class="n">table_xpath</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="sa">r</span><span class="s1">'//*[@id="inner-content"]/div[2]/div[3]/div/div[1]/div/div/city-history-observation'</span>
    <span class="n">timeout</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">60</span>

    <span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'weather_data.csv'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">usecols</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Date'</span><span class="p">])</span>
    <span class="n">dates_acquired</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_datetime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Date</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">date</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>

    <span class="k">del</span> <span class="n">df</span> <span class="c1">#not needed after a quick data check</span>

    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">d</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">daterange</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">START</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">END</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="k">try</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">d</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">dates_acquired</span><span class="p">:</span>
                <span class="k">continue</span>
            <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
                <span class="n">d</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">d</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">strftime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'%Y-%m-</span><span class="si">%d</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">url</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">f</span><span class="s2">"https://www.wunderground.com/history/daily/ZSSS/date/</span><span class="si">{d}</span><span class="s2">/req_city=Wuhan&req_statename=China"</span>
            <span class="n">driver</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">url</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">element_present</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">EC</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">presence_of_element_located</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="n">By</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">TAG_NAME</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'table'</span><span class="p">))</span>
            <span class="n">WebDriverWait</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">driver</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">timeout</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">until</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">element_present</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">table</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">driver</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">find_element_by_xpath</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">table_xpath</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="c1"># next_col_link = driver.find_element_by_xpath(next_colum_xpath)</span>
            <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">el</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">enumerate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">table</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">find_elements_by_tag_name</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"tr"</span><span class="p">)):</span>
                <span class="n">observations</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'Date'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="n">d</span><span class="p">}</span>
                <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>
                    <span class="k">continue</span>
                <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">datum</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">enumerate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">el</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">find_elements_by_tag_name</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"td"</span><span class="p">)):</span>
                    <span class="n">observations</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">header</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">datum</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span>
                <span class="n">csv_writer</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">writerow</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">observations</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">except</span> <span class="n">TimeoutException</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">f</span><span class="s2">"Timed out waiting for page to load on day </span><span class="si">{d}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">missed_dates</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">d</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Let me break this down a bit.</p>
<p>To get at the table element in the webpage, I first tried targeting it with CSS selectors, but that wasn't working too well, as the table is asynchronously generated using Ajax (I discovered after digging around in the page source).</p>
<p>Luckily, Chrome came to the rescue, with it's nifty "copy XPath location" option in the source inspector. That is from whence the</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">table_xpath</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="sa">r</span><span class="s1">'//*[@id="inner-content"]/div[2]/div[3]/div/div[1]/div/div/city-history-observation'</span>
</pre></div>
<p>expression comes.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>As for the asynchronicity of the table loading, pulling data from god knows where in the cloud, that's where these nifty bits come in:</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">element_present</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">EC</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">presence_of_element_located</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="n">By</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">TAG_NAME</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'table'</span><span class="p">))</span><span class="err">`</span>
<span class="n">WebDriverWait</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">driver</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">timeout</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">until</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">element_present</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
<p>I simply experimented with different lengths for timeout, as this is highly variable depending on the stability of your connection and the presence/lack of presence of a Great Firewall in your country.</p>
<p>This also leads us to the next twist.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Twist-2:-Doing-this-in-China-meant-slow-speeds-over-the-VPN-and-failed-page-loads.">Twist 2: Doing this in China meant slow speeds over the VPN and failed page loads.<a class="anchor-link" href="#Twist-2:-Doing-this-in-China-meant-slow-speeds-over-the-VPN-and-failed-page-loads.">¶</a></h3><p>That's why I have a bit of code logging successful date scrapes and checking whether a date has already been acquired. In total, I had to run this code 3 or 4 times before I was satisfied with the completeness of scraping two years of data for Shanghai, Wuhan, and several other Chinese cities.</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'weather_dates.csv'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">usecols</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Date'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">dates_acquired</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_datetime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Date</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">date</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>And here is where stuff actually gets done (note the #comment above <code>maximize_window()</code>:</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">with</span> <span class="nb">open</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'weather_data.csv'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'a'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="n">f</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">driver</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">webdriver</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">chrome</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">webdriver</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">WebDriver</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">executable_path</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">chrome_path</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">options</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">options</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    
    <span class="c1">#Maximizing the window was necessary to ensure that the table was fully expanded, </span>
    <span class="c1">#since columns need to be displayed in order to get at the data they contain</span>
    <span class="n">driver</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">maximize_window</span><span class="p">()</span>

    <span class="n">START</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">datetime</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">date</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">2017</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">END</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">datetime</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">date</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">2018</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">31</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="c1">#just a declaration for the scraper</span>
    <span class="n">missed_dates</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>

    <span class="n">writer</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">csv</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DictWriter</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">f</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fieldnames</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">header</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">scrape_weather_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">writer</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Success!-(After-3-4-tries-because-of-failed-page-loads)">Success! (After 3-4 tries because of failed page loads)<a class="anchor-link" href="#Success!-(After-3-4-tries-because-of-failed-page-loads)">¶</a></h3><p>If you have any experience with concurrency, this project is also a good candidate for parallelization with multiprocessing. I could have done that, but this was speedy enough that it wasn't worth the trouble.</p>
<p>But now, the data need to be cleaned and transformed for the database insertion, and I went ahead and created indicator variables for rainy/not rainy. In my later analysis, I also computed proportions of a day in either a rainy or a sunshine state, since the whole purpose of getting this data was to observe umbrella purchasing patterns around weather changes.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'weather_data.csv'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop_duplicates</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">dropna</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">inplace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1">#just in case. Don't you love chaining operations?</span>

<span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'obs_ts'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_datetime</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Date</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="s1">' '</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Time</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'temp_F'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Temperature</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nb">float</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]))</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'dew_point_F'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Dew Point'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nb">float</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]))</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'humidity'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Humidity'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nb">float</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'pressure_in'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Pressure'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nb">float</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]))</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'precipitation_in'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Precip.'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nb">float</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]))</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'accum_precip_in'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Precip Accum'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nb">float</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]))</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'wind_speed_mph'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Wind Speed'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nb">float</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]))</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'wind_gust_mph'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Wind Gust'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nb">float</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]))</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">obs_ts</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">min</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="c1">#Yeah, I know I should just have renamed the columns before transforming them with functions, </span>
<span class="c1">#but the df is not so large in memory</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'Date'</span><span class="p">,</span> 
         <span class="s1">'Time'</span><span class="p">,</span> 
         <span class="s1">'Temperature'</span><span class="p">,</span> 
         <span class="s1">'Dew Point'</span><span class="p">,</span> 
         <span class="s1">'Humidity'</span><span class="p">,</span> 
         <span class="s1">'Wind Speed'</span><span class="p">,</span>
         <span class="s1">'Wind Gust'</span><span class="p">,</span> 
         <span class="s1">'Pressure'</span><span class="p">,</span> 
         <span class="s1">'Precip.'</span><span class="p">,</span> 
         <span class="s1">'Precip Accum'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">inplace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">#no other changes need for these two</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rename</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">'Wind'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'wind_direction'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Condition'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'condition'</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">inplace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s1">'obs_ts'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'condition'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'temp_F'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'dew_point_F'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'humidity'</span><span class="p">,</span>
       <span class="s1">'pressure_in'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'precipitation_in'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'accum_precip_in'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'wind_speed_mph'</span><span class="p">,</span>
       <span class="s1">'wind_gust_mph'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'wind_direction'</span><span class="p">]]</span>

<span class="n">precipitation</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'Light Rain'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Light Rain Shower'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Rain Shower'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Heavy Rain Shower'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'T-Storm'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Light Rain with Thunder'</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="s1">'Thunder'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Heavy T-Storm'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Heavy T-Storm / Windy'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Thunder / Windy'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'T-Storm / Windy'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Rain / Windy'</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="s1">'Light Rain / Windy'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Heavy Rain Shower / Windy'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Light Rain Shower / Windy'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Rain Shower / Windy'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Rain'</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="s1">'Light Snow'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Snow'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Mist'</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'precip_flag'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">condition</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">1</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">x</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">precipitation</span> <span class="k">else</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'weather_cleaned.csv'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">header</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Insertion-into-the-DB">Insertion into the DB<a class="anchor-link" href="#Insertion-into-the-DB">¶</a></h3><p>After all that, writing to a Postgres database for shared access, querying for other projects, and storage.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">postgre_config</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="n">OUR_SUPER_SECRET_CONFIG</span><span class="p">}</span>

<span class="n">cols</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'obs_ts'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'condition'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'temp_F'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'dew_point_F'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'humidity'</span><span class="p">,</span>

<span class="k">with</span> <span class="nb">open</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'weather_cleaned.csv'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'r'</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="n">f</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">values</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">q</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">cur</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mogrify</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"INSERT INTO weather_shanghai VALUES </span><span class="se">\</span>
<span class="s2">        (</span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">,</span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">,</span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">,</span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">,</span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">,</span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">,</span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">,</span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">,</span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">,</span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">,</span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">,</span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s2">) </span><span class="se">\</span>
<span class="s2">        ON CONFLICT DO NOTHING"</span><span class="p">,</span>

entry.title: Crypto comparison with webscrape and visualization
entry.summary:
Quick and Dirty Digital Currency Comparison – Ethereum and Bitcoin

Question: How have the closing prices in Ethereum and Bitcoin changed together?¶

My hypothesis here is that they, at least recently, have been more or less moving up and down together, albeit with some time lag. If the visualization bears this out, then a possible explanation is that sentiment changes for Bitcoin lead to similar price movements for Ethereum, albeit with time lag, given the large differences in volume of coins and pricing per coin.

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1>Quick and Dirty Digital Currency Comparison <html>–</html> Ethereum and Bitcoin</h1>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Question:-How-have-the-closing-prices-in-Ethereum-and-Bitcoin-changed-together?">Question: How have the closing prices in Ethereum and Bitcoin changed together?<a class="anchor-link" href="#Question:-How-have-the-closing-prices-in-Ethereum-and-Bitcoin-changed-together?">¶</a></h2><p>My hypothesis here is that they, at least recently, have been more or less moving up and down together, albeit with some time lag. If the visualization bears this out, then a possible explanation is that sentiment changes for Bitcoin lead to similar price movements for Ethereum, albeit with time lag, given the large differences in volume of coins and pricing per coin.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">datetime</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">plt</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">seaborn</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">sns</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pandas</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">pd</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">requests</span>

<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">bs4</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">BeautifulSoup</span>

<span class="o">%</span><span class="k">matplotlib</span> inline

<span class="n">NOW</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">datetime</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">datetime</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">now</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">date</span><span class="p">())</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">NOW</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">NOW</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'-'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">NOW</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">''</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">join</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">NOW</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">r</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">requests</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/ethereum/historical-data/?start=20170101&end=</span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">NOW</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">soup</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">BeautifulSoup</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">r</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'html.parser'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">table</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">soup</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">table</span>
<span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">th</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">th</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">table</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">findAll</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"th"</span><span class="p">)]</span>
<span class="n">rows</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">array</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">table</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">findAll</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"td"</span><span class="p">)])</span>
<span class="n">rows</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">rows</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reshape</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rows</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">)),</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">eth</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">rows</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">eth</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">eth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:]]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">eth</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">eth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:]]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">str</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">','</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"float"</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">eth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Date</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_datetime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">eth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Date</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">eth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">

<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ax1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">fig</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_figwidth</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">fig</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_figheight</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_title</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"Closing prices from 2017 to Present"</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">hfmt</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dates</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DateFormatter</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'%m-</span><span class="si">%d</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xaxis</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_major_formatter</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">hfmt</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">xaxis_date</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"ETH value in USD"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'color'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'green'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'size'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">15</span><span class="p">})</span>
<span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">eth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Date</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">eth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Close</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'-g'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">linewidth</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">twinx</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">eth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Date</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">btc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Close</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'-b'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">linewidth</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"BTC value in USD"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'color'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'blue'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'size'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">15</span><span class="p">});</span>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Discussion">Discussion<a class="anchor-link" href="#Discussion">¶</a></h3><p>To my surprise, in terms of price gains/losses relative to the sum of coin values across 2017, ETH appears to be even more unstable than BTC, though their movements seem tightly correlated. That said, the year-long relative trajectory is unmistakable—massive growth, particularly in the month of December for BTC, and as predicted, the explosion in ETH value lagged by about a month, possibly as people shifted money out of BTC and into ETH (note its rapid drop just as ETH really took off in January).</p>
</div>
